benignancy noun [U]
(PERSON)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal the quality or state of being pleasant and kind: She wasn't entirely convinced of the stranger's benignancy until he offered to call the police for her. The benignancy of the governor's remarks might have shown that she meant well, but it was clear that voters wished she had shown more fire and anger about the incident.

benignancy noun [U]
(GROWTH)
medical
  specialized (of a growth) the quality of not being cancer and not being likely to be harmful: The doctors used both CT scans and mammography to help determine the malignancy or benignancy of the tumours. We were relieved after the doctor called to confirm the benignancy of the mole on my arm. Compare
malignancy
